@TheRealVordox What I like best as far as the combat in this game goesare the battles against the colossal foes such as *cough* spoiler *cough* the Dracolich *end of spoiler*.

snippet.textDisplay:
@ everyone fighting: Sheesh, this isn't the place for that, go outside or agree to disagree. Whatever you may think of this game, everyone else is also entitled to their opinion on it.

@ SupraDarky: I liked the game, but honestly it's not what I'd call a proper Castlevania game. The ending was a major let-down for me too. Yet in terms of gameplay, music and especially the boss-battles I'd have to say it was a great game and I especially like this track.
snippet.textOriginal:
@ everyone fighting: Sheesh, this isn't the place for that, go outside or agree to disagree. Whatever you may think of this game, everyone else is also entitled to their opinion on it.

@ SupraDarky: I liked the game, but honestly it's not what I'd call a proper Castlevania game. The ending was a major let-down for me too. Yet in terms of gameplay, music and especially the boss-battles I'd have to say it was a great game and I especially like this track.

snippet.textDisplay: @FreeCorps Yeah, it takes away from enjoyment of other 2-D side scrollers... because we're still not getting them. We STILL haven't gotten Castlevania IV-2. After all these freaking years, they're wasting more time on these crappy games than going back and making GOOD Castlevania games. So you can shut your fat mouth and learn what a good Castlevania game is. Metroidvanias are still solid Castelvania games that retain what makes good Castlevania games; GoW Castlevania games DO NOT.

snippet.textDisplay:
@vincentBurden I know it's a Reboot, but the thin line is too ..."thin".
As I also said, if they had not used the Castlevania title only to get attention, they may have created their own new franchise.
Don't get me wrong, the game is good, but I had way more expectations to have some of the classic moves or story twists.
Just that I got bored of the game was more for the difficulty terms, as Paladin is pretty....weak once you get the Maxed Upgrades, heck even the last boss died in seconds for me

snippet.textDisplay: @Wolfdie Ummm... duh? You don't play a Zelda game expecting it to be about basketball. You don't play Mario Kart expecting it to be first person shooter. You don't play Marvel vs Capcom expecting it to be an RPG. And you DEFINITELY don't play a Castlevania expecting it to be a freaking GoW clone. They've experimented many times, they've tried many times, and failed each time. I'm sick of it. I'm sick of waiting for the true sequel to the great almighty Super Castlevania IV. I'm sick of these.
snippet.textOriginal: @Wolfdie Ummm... duh? You don't play a Zelda game expecting it to be about basketball. You don't play Mario Kart expecting it to be first person shooter. snippet.textDisplay:
I am a Metroidvania fanboy who really enjoyed this game, The story was pleasing and my actions felt more real and meaningful. The game was alive (haha, the irony) and the puzzles were quite fun. Gameplay was severely challenging and the controls were really responsive. There were plenty of familiar references, but this time around, the references had substance. 

I guess my only complaint is some of the camera angles and unsure where to jump locations.
snippet.textOriginal:
I am a Metroidvania fanboy who really enjoyed this game, The story was pleasing and my actions felt more real and meaningful. The game was alive (haha, the irony) and the puzzles were quite fun. Gameplay was severely challenging and the controls were really responsive. There were plenty of familiar references, but this time around, the references had substance. 

I guess my only complaint is some of the camera angles and unsure where to jump locations.

snippet.textDisplay:
@vincentBurden Slogra: Cameo...
Rinaldo: The only "almost same" character, with him gone mad and senile and created weapons. This is what I considered "Good" connection to the other game, and the name Castlevania of the Castle.
Vampire Killer: Sarah again?
Bloody Tears: Not in LoS if I remember correctly.

Still could've been an own franchise with no connection to Castlevania Standards.

snippet.textDisplay:
@TheRealVordox Clock Tower, last time I saw, the old Clock Tower was not as "Futuristic" like the High Tech Clock Tower in this game.
Carmilla: Carmilla was a Witch, not an Vampyre. Name only.
Laura: I'm pretty sure she was a servant. A twist is good though with what they did with her, Interesting character. Still a name with a huge change so any other name would fit.
Malphas: Great change for her, which was good.
Veros Wood: Keen eye you have. :P but yes, this was also okay, but not great.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky I Really liked this game. Yes it has some elements that are very akin to God of War, and in my opinion the story gets a little butchered in the end, but up until that point i'd still have given it a 9/10, and this is coming from somebody who's fairly picky. It might disappoint Castlevania fans who play it thinking it's going to be like any other Castlevania game, and its not. But it stands strongly on its own.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky I Really liked this game. Yes it has some elements that are very akin to God of War, and in my opinion the story gets a little butchered in the end, but up until that point i'd still have given it a 9/10, and this is coming from somebody who's fairly picky. It might disappoint Castlevania fans who play it thinking it's going to be like any other Castlevania game, and its not. But it stands strongly on its own.

snippet.textDisplay:
@genesisSOC Actually, alot of old Castlevania fans enjoyed Lament of Innocence, and to some degree Curse of Darkness.

3D Castlevania can work if it's in the same premise  like those 2 games that follow the original storyline of Castlevania.

This, however, did not feel like a Castlevania game at all. I was litterally BORED of the game once I hit about 1/4 of the game, and I completed it on Paladin level.
It's just...wrong type of gameplay and scenary.

snippet.textDisplay: @vibratingcat Are you seriously trying to compare this game to Super Castlevania IV and SotN? I really don't see how any true Castlevania fan would ever enjoy a game like this. The story, battle and world don't feel like a Castlevania game. It feels like a crappy game, like it's butchering the series and what makes a "good" Castlevania game. Aren't you sick of this new crap? Aren't you ready for a true sequel to Super Castlevania IV?
snippet.textOriginal: @vibratingcat Are you seriously trying to compare this game to Super Castlevania IV and SotN? I really don't see how any true Castlevania fan would ever enjoy a game like this. The story, battle and world don't feel like a Castlevania game. It feels like a crappy game, like it's butchering the series and what makes a "good" Castlevania game. Aren't you sick of this new crap? Aren't you ready for a true sequel to Super Castlevania IV?

snippet.textDisplay: @Wolfdie The spells, exploring, backtracking, enemies, leveling up, weapons, hamminess, fights, boss battles, characters, Dracula, and just about everything else did not feel like Castlevania at all. It was all very lacking and easily forgettable. Did not feel satisfying. Did not feel "good" like other Castlevania games. Are you seriously trying to compare LoI and CoD to Super Castlevania IV and SotN?
snippet.textOriginal: @Wolfdie The spells, exploring, backtracking, enemies, leveling up, weapons, hamminess, fights, boss battles, characters, Dracula, and just about everything else did not feel like Castlevania at all. Are you seriously trying to compare LoI and CoD to Super Castlevania IV and SotN?

snippet.textDisplay: @Delarius86 "1 3D CV game is bad." ...? There was two on the N64, two on PS2... That's four. They're not Castlevania. They don't feel like Castlevania at all. Neither does this one. 3D Castlevanias can work, but they're doing it wrong. I'd rather them stop trying and experimenting and return back to Super Castlevania IV and make us a true sequel to that game. That's my main issue.
snippet.textOriginal: @Delarius86 "1 3D CV game is bad." ...? There was two on the N64, two on PS2... That's four. They're not Castlevania. They don't feel like Castlevania at all. Neither does this one. 3D Castlevanias can work, but they're doing it wrong. I'd rather them stop trying and experimenting and return back to Super Castlevania IV and make us a true sequel to that game. That's my main issue.

snippet.textDisplay: @Delarius86 Nah, it's because Castlevania and Metroid have one major thing in common: they're 2D. All 3D Castlevania games haven't been good, it just doesn't work. Metroid went 3D and it worked, but that's because it remained a Metroid game. 3D Castlevania games aren't anything like Castlevania at all, especially not GoW.
snippet.textOriginal: @Delarius86 Nah, it's because Castlevania and Metroid have one major thing in common: they're 2D. All 3D Castlevania games haven't been good, it just doesn't work. snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky don't worry you are not the only way who really dug the hell out of the re-visioning of the Castlevania series.  LOS is one of the finest action games that starts off slow at first but it eventually kicks the awesome level up to 11 and becomes quite an adventure that is in the veins of the old Castlevania games of the Nintendo era unlike the ones released on the DSi or XBLA.  Definitely look forward to seeing where they go from here.   :)
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky don't worry you are not the only way who really dug the hell out of the re-visioning of the Castlevania series.  LOS is one of the finest action games that starts off slow at first but it eventually kicks the awesome level up to 11 and becomes quite an adventure that is in the veins of the old Castlevania games of the Nintendo era unlike the ones released on the DSi or XBLA.  Definitely look forward to seeing where they go from here.   :)

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky It's not just like when SotN came out. When SotN came out, it was great. They did it -right,- and Metroid was already a good kind of game. GoW is not a good game. Castlevania and Metroid mix very well, it makes sense. Castlevania and GoW do not and never will.

snippet.textDisplay:
Anyone else a Castlevania fanboy who actually really enjoyed this game? It's in my top 5 for 2010 and I can't wait for both DLC packs. I know quite a lot of people who didn't like it, saying it's just a GoW clone or that it's too long.

As the game is still relatively new, try to hold off on spoilers, especially the ending. Also, this theme is actually inspired by the Waterfall theme from Castlevania IV, it's a nice touch.
snippet.textOriginal:
Anyone else a Castlevania fanboy who actually really enjoyed this game? It's in my top 5 for 2010 and I can't wait for both DLC packs. I know quite a lot of people who didn't like it, saying it's just a GoW clone or that it's too long.

As the game is still relatively new, try to hold off on spoilers, especially the ending. Also, this theme is actually inspired by the Waterfall theme from Castlevania IV, it's a nice touch.
